Description: Neck and shoulder sherd (mended from two fragments) of Aeolian Black Polychrome pottery oinochoe; fine orange clay with much gold mica; exterior: from top, below junction of neck and shoulder, frieze of incised tongues alternately added white, black and added red; below,white-red-white-red-white band.
Curator's comments: According to NAA analysis carried out on the sherd by Hans Mommsen (Bonn), the vessel falls into chemical group G and hence originated from the region of Aeolis, probably Kyme or Larisa: see Kerschner 2006.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.256, no.2)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 54, Table 1, G (Nauk 12))
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (NAU 7)
Kerschner 2006 / On the Provenance of Aiolian Pottery (p. 123, fig. 9, sample no. Nauk 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.49)
